title: JSON schema for Benchpress config file.

benchmark_setup.title: benchmark_setup
benchmark_setup.description: Defines the actual benchmarking setup, where the resources are references by their corresponding id.

data.title: data
data.description: The data setup for the study.

evaluation.title: evaluation
evaluation.description: This section contains the available evaluation methods.

benchmarks.title: benchmarks
benchmarks.description: ROC plots and other benchmarking statistics.

graph_true_plots.title: graph_true_plots
graph_true_plots.description: This module plots the true underlying graphs. The figures are saved in results/adjmat and copied to results/output/graph_true_plots/.

graph_true_stats.title: graph_true_stats
graph_true_stats.description: This module plots statistics of the true underlying graphs. The figures are saved in to results/output/graph_true_stats/.

ggally_ggpairs.title: ggally_ggpairs
ggally_ggpairs.description: This module plots the data using pairs. The figures are saved in to results/output/ggally_ggpairs/.

graph_plots.title: graph_plots
graph_plots.description: This module plots and saves the estimated graphs in dot-format. The figures are saved in results/adjmat and copied to results/output/graph_plots/.

mcmc_traj_plots.title: mcmc_traj_plots
mcmc_traj_plots.description: This module plots the so called score values in the trajectory or the value of a given functional. The currently supported functionals are the number of edges for the graphs (size) and the graph score. The mcmc_traj_plots module has a list of objects, where each object has an id field for the algorithm object id, a burn-in field (burn_in) and a field specifying the functional to be considered (functional). Since the trajectories tend to be very long, the user may choose to thin out the trajectory by only considering every graph at a given interval length specified by the thinning field. The plots are saved in results/mcmc_traj_plots/ and copied to results/output/mcmc_traj_plots/.

mcmc_heatmaps.title: mcmc_heatmaps
mcmc_heatmaps.description: Plots mean graph as a heatmap from an MCMC trajectory of graphs.

mcmc_autocorr_plots.title: mcmc_autocorr_plots
mcmc_autocorr_plots.description: Plots mean graph as a heatmap from an MCMC trajectory of graphs.

resources.title: resources
resources.description: The available modules for generating graphs, parameters, data and structure learning algorithms.

pcalg_randdag.title: pcalg_randdag
pcalg_randdag.description: Sampling graph using randDAG from the pcalg package.

trilearn_cta.title: trilearn_cta
trilearn_cta.description: Sample decomposable graph using the Christmas tree algorithm (CTA) from the trilearn package.

bandmat.title: bandmat
bandmat.description: Generates a graph with band structured adjacency matrix.

rand_bandmat.title: rand_bandmat
rand_bandmat.description: Generates a graph with band structured adjacency matrix of varying with.

bdgraph_graphsim.title: bdgraph_graphsim
bdgraph_graphsim.description: Generates an undirected graph using graph.sim from the R package BDgraph.

bnlearn_iambfdr.description: Incremental Association with FDR Correction (IAMB FDR) objects
bnlearn_iambfdr.title: bnlearn_iambfdr

mcmc_autocorr_plots_item.title: mcmc_autocorr_plots item
mcmc_autocorr_plots_item.description: Plots the auto correlation for a given functional in a MCMC trajectory.

mcmc_traj_plots_item.title: mcmc_traj_plots item
mcmc_traj_plots_item.description: This module plots the so called score values in the trajectory or the value of a given functional. The currently supported functionals are the number of edges for the graphs (size) and the graph score. The mcmc_traj_plots module has a list of objects, where each object has an id field for the algorithm object id, a burn-in field (burn_in) and a field specifying the functional to be considered (functional). Since the trajectories tend to be very long, the user may choose to thin out the trajectory by only considering every graph at a given interval length specified by the thinning field. The plots are saved in results/mcmc_traj_plots/ and copied to results/output/mcmc_traj_plots/.

mcmc_heatmaps_item.title: MCMC mean graph plot
mcmc_heatmaps_item.description: Plots mean graph as a heatmap from an MCMC trajectory of graphs.

active.description: Set to false if you dont want to plot it.

notears_parameters_sampling.title: notears_parameters_sampling item
notears_parameters_sampling.description: Notears parameter sampling for Gaissian Bayesian networks. This requires that the adjaceny_matrix (graph) is of type notears_dag_sampling

notears_dag_sampling.title: notears_dag_sampling item
notears_dag_sampling.description:
Graph sampling method provided by the notears package. 
 Documentation: https://github.com/jmoss20/notears

trilearn_cta.title: trilearn_cta item
trilearn_cta.description:
Graph sampling method provided by the trilearn package. 
 Documentation: https://github.com/felixleopoldo/trilearn

bandmat.title: bandmat item
bandmat.description: A graph with a band structured adjacency matrix

rand_bandmat.title: rand_bandmat item
rand_bandmat.description: A graph with a band structured adjacency matrix with random width.

anyOf.title: range
anyOf.description: List of 2 integers [a, b], where a<=b.

anyOf.title: range
anyOf.description: List of 2 integers [a, b], where a<=b.

data_setup_dict.title: data item
data_setup_dict.description:
Description of the data model and sampling setup. Make sure that the id's are properly combined.
 If a CSV file is specified as data_id then parameters_id and seed_range should be null whereas graph_id should be the true graphs that generated the dataset.

parameters_id.title: parameters_id
parameters_id.description: ID of a module object in the parameters section.

seed_range.title: seed_range
seed_range.description: This data setup will be simulated for this range of seeds. E.g. seed_range:[1,3] will generate 3 datsets (and corresponding models) with seeds 1,2,3.

anyOf.title: range
anyOf.description: List of 2 integers [a, b], where a<=b.

iid.title: iid
iid.description: Data sampling from disctete Bayesian network.

pcalg_randdag.title: pcalg_randdag item
pcalg_randdag.description: An instance of pcalg randdag. Sampling of a DAG with specified maximum averge number for parents for the nodes.

trilearn_hyper-dir.title: trilearn_hyper-dir item
trilearn_hyper-dir.description: Parameter setting for a hyper Dirichlet distribution

trilearn_intra-class.title: trilearn_intra-class item
trilearn_intra-class.description: Parameter setting for a graph intra-class model

trilearn_g_inv_wishart.title: trilearn_g_inv_wishart item
trilearn_g_inv_wishart.description: Parameter setting for a graph inverse-Wishart model

bdgraph_rgwish.title: bdgraph_rgwish item
bdgraph_rgwish.description: Parameter setting for a G-Wishart model. Works for undirected graphs.

sem_params.title: sem_params item
sem_params.description: Parameter setting for sampling SEM params.

flexnonnegint.title: Non-negative integer(s)
flexnonnegint.description: Non-negative integers, (0,1,2,...), or array of the same.

flexprobnull.title: flexprobnull
flexprobnull.description: Number(s) in the range [0,1], or null.

trilearn_pgibbs.title: trilearn_pgibbs item
trilearn_pgibbs.description: Parameter setting for trilearn with log-linear decomposable model.

parallelDG.title: ParallelDG item
parallelDG.description: Parallel Sampling of decomposable graphs with log-linear decomposable model.

id.title: Unique identifier
id.description: Unique identifier for that can be used as reference in the benchmark_setup.

id.title: Unique identifier
id.description: Unique identifier for that can be used as reference in the benchmark_setup.

gt13_multipair.title: gt13_multipair item
gt13_multipair.description:
Green & Thomas algorithm for learning decomopasble graphs.
 Source: Green, P. J., & Thomas, A. (2013). Sampling decomposable graphs using a Markov chain on junction trees. Biometrika, 100(1), 91-110.

gg99_singlepair.title: gg99_singlepair item
gg99_singlepair.description: Guidici & Green algorithm for learning decomopasble graphs.
